column1: A pet grizzly bear had been for a number of years a feature at Hartranft's. As a puny infant
column5: was brought in off the Teton Mountains
column6: and as milk was scarcer than money at the horse-ranch
column7: he was aristocratically fed on malted milk.On this expensive diet the cub throve amazingly. Good feeding was continued after his weaning from the rubber nipple
column8: and at the end of three years Solomon had grown to be a fat wooly monster. He was kept chained to a post in the warm season
column9: and had an enclosed stall in a big barn for his winter quarters. Ordinarily he was good-natured
column10: but he was a rough and not altogether safe playfellow. The near-by bawling of cattle always aroused in him ebullitions of rage."Solomon's got an awful grouch agin any noise bigger than what he can make hisself
column11: was the saying of the ranch hands.
